revised_title: On the Decomposition of Light and Reflective Forces at the Separating Surfaces of Media
tldr: The author investigates the reflection and decomposition of light at the separating surfaces of media with the same and different refractive powers. He discovers that the reflected light's color changes depending on the angle of incidence and the type of media used. This phenomenon can be explained using the undulatory theory of light, suggesting that the density or elasticity of the ether varies near the surface of different bodies.
